intro: Allocarya ambigens, commonly known as the ambiguous Allocarya, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Allocarya ambigens is often found in alpine habitats and is adapted to withstand cold and dry conditions.
